programs, services or activities, or in its hiring or employment practices. The district also provides equal access to its facilities to the Boy Scouts and other patriotic youth groups, as required by the Boy Scouts of America Equal Access Act. div.data-react-data-bundle: {"notifications":[{"id":7538,"message":"Under the Florida Department of Education\u2019s directive, Columbia County Schools will be closed from March 30, 2020, through May 1, 2020. During this time, we will utilize remote learning for all students in VPK through 12th grade. All students must stay home during this time. All Spring 2019 - 2020 state assessments have been canceled. \r\n\r\nPlease continue to follow the website and Columbia County Schools Twitter account (@columbiak12) for the latest information.","type":"banner"}]}

div.div:
Our students have access to some of the best educators and programs in Florida. The Columbia County School Board focuses on educating students in an environment of trust and respect, with student success being our ultimate goal. We continually challenge the mind, encourage creativity, and offer opportunities for school and community involvement.
We are thankful to have such dedicated teachers, students, and parents in our county.**
Mission Statement
To create a safe, orderly learning environment conducive to the preparation of highly motivated students;
To work to ensure that all students achieve to the maximum potential of their abilities; and
To prepare students to be successful in their career/technical training or higher education and in the workplace.

LAKE CITY, FL 32055

span.data-emptytext: Columbia County School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value:
Public Records Request
The Columbia County School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age disability or marital status in its educational programs, services or activities, or in its hiring or employment practices. The district also provides equal access to its facilities to the Boy Scouts and other patriotic youth groups, as required by the Boy Scouts of America Equal Access Act. Questions, complaints, or requests for additional information regarding discrimination or harassment may be sent to: Hope Jernigan Columbia County School District Equity Officer (386) 755-8015

br.br:
The Columbia County School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age disability or marital status in its educational programs, services or activities, or in its hiring or employment practices. The district also provides equal access to its facilities to the Boy Scouts and other patriotic youth groups, as required by the Boy Scouts of America Equal Access Act.
Questions, complaints, or requests for additional information regarding discrimination or harassment may be sent to: Hope Jernigan Columbia County School District Equity Officer (386) 755-8015

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
